quest.name: In Good Faith
journal: Urianger stands over Runar, ready to begin his ministrations.
objectives: Use the aetherial lamp to find a location that resonates with the Lifestream.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Master...Matoya...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Rest, Forename, I prithee. I shall attend to Runar's ministrations.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Though I am loath to trust him, I suppose we have no choice. For now, at least.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Do you really think he can bring her back?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Could it truly be within his power to pluck Y'shtola from the Lifestream as he claimeth? 'Tis a feat beyond even the greatest practitioners of the arcane. Yet if he would attempt it, we cannot well stand in his way.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: By the blessed Dark, there is yet hope!

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: I confess, I do not fully understand what is happening here─but I gather we were right to bring this man to you.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: We found him asleep in the shade of a tree near the ruins. A fine way to behave when one's companions are in dire straits.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: I am relieved to know he is an acquaintance of yours. Though I see you are not close. If he should displease you, we would be happy to deal with him...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Now then, if I'm to fetch her for you, I will require a suitable place to work. We must find somewhere that resonates strongly with the Lifestream.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: And by we, I mean you. To that end, I give you this─an aetherial lamp of my own design.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Keep it close as you venture out into the woods. The brighter the glow, the stronger the location's resonance with the Lifestream. Once you've found a likely spot, all you need do is whistle.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: You do know how to whistle, don't you, hero? Just put your lips together and blow.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To find a location that resonates with the Lifestream, you will need to search the area marked on your map.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Use your aetherial lamp to pinpoint an ideal location then call for Emet-Selch.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Well, what are you standing around here for? Get searching! You do want to save her, don't you?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The lamplight is near blinding. Perhaps now would be a good time to call for Emet-Selch.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The lamp glows brightly.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The lamp glows warmly.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The lamp glows faintly.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The lamp is dim, as if it might go out at any moment.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Did Emet-Selch not return with you?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Though I struggle to form the words...I am glad that Emet-Selch was here.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We can but pray Y'shtola never does anything so reckless again.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Urianger once told me that being immersed in the Lifestream can cause irreparable harm to the body. Do you suppose Y'shtola is all right?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In all of history, there are but few who have returned from a misadventure in the aetherial sea possessed of mind and body both.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To have done so twice beggareth belief. 'Tis plain Y'shtola wanteth not for favor among the Twelve.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: By all that is dark, Master Matoya is returned! She stands here before me yet still I cannot believe it.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: We are both gladdened and relieved to see your companion returned hale and whole.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: With your friend returned, you will resume your exploration of the ruins, yes? But say the word and we shall assist you.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: It was fate who brought you to us, and fate who returned your companion to you. She yet smiles on Ronka, I am sure of it.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: What a touching reunion that was. It fair brought a tear to the eye. But as we both know, such tender moments are nothing if not momentary.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Before long, they will remember their many differences, and return to squabbling.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You're wrong. They're better than that.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Says the arch Bringer of Chaos.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Oh, if I had a gil for every time one of you heroes made that claim...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Ah hah hah! Flattery will get you nowhere, my deardear boy.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: But seriously, we Ascians do what we do for the greater good. For the Rejoining.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Though we may sow the seeds of chaos, it is man who tends them, he who reaps their bountiful harvest.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: But I grow tired of these arguments. If you would kindly refrain from retorting and return to your customary brooding silence, I will take it as thanks for rescuing your companion and leave it at that.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Now, we mustn't keep your friends waiting.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: I told you, I tire of these inane arguments. Shouldn't you be getting ready to slay the next Lightwarden or something?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: My apologies for having put you all through such an ordeal. I could see no other way to save the Night's Blessed. Happily, both they and I yet live─thanks to you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But our work here is not yet done. We must make ready to enter the Qitana Ravel, and put the Lightwarden to the sword.
